element.element: Dynamic sites development

Web masters, with Silex you will be able to build a website with external data sources and dynamic content. With the provided components, named the Oof components - see http://oof.sourceforge.net , you can plug a connector to nice looking and interactive lists, which you manipulate with drag and drop, and customize either in Silex or even more deeply with Flash. The ready to use connectors let you connect to these sources, without a line of code* text files, flat files or ini files* RSS feeds* XML files, XML services, XML RPC, and php scripts returning XML, e.g. these APIs: google (youtube, picassa, agenda, ...), facebook, yahoo (flickr), twitter... And Silex API of course, which allows you to list server side folders, do queries to search deeply in your Silex site, acces config or language files...* a php gateway - see amf php to interact easily with your database* spreadsheet stored serverside, in these formats: Microsoft office .xls, .xlsx and Open Office .ods files. You can use this in order to store data or to retrieve values computed at runtime, coded as formulas in the spreadsheet and depending on values provided by the user.An other interesting point for webmasters is the ability that Silex has to be as friendly as HTML when we come to search engines. The sites produced with Silex are very well indexed by yahoo, google, bing etc. since each page of the site has an HTML5 equivalent. And each page can be accessed directly thanks to the native deeplink system.
